conversations.value:
Dear Admissions Committee,

My interest in Artificial Intelligence (AI) was sparked after reading the book "Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies" by Nick Bostrom. As I delved deeper into the subject, I realized that AI has the potential to revolutionize not only the field of technology but also a wide range of industries, including civil and transportation engineering. That realization led me to pursue a major in Civil Engineering and auxiliary degrees in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence at the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay.

As a third-year undergraduate student, I am eager to take my passion for AI to the next level by participating in the Aalto Science Institute (AScI) international summer research (internship) program at Aalto University. My background in data analysis, machine learning, and AI, as well as my experience in data-driven modeling, neural network, and natural language processing, make me a strong candidate for the program. I have completed several projects that demonstrate my expertise in these areas, including a course project where I conducted an extensive data analysis on the Learning Behavior and Learning Strategies data set, of 160 students and created an interactive dashboard using Tableau to visualize and gather insights from data. Additionally, I have worked as an AI intern at various companies, where I have automated the company’s manual data mapping using customized word embeddings and SQL, Built a neural network model that could alert and warn drivers if they feel sleepy while driving and automated the complete trading process using Kite Connect API and basic regression algorithms for prospective predictions. Currently, I am working with Professor Nagendra Rao Velaga, where I am conducting a systematic literature review for the research on effect of navigation and various in-vehicle systems on the driver.

I have also had experience in systematic literature review while completing my project with Professor Ramkumar Rajendran, which would be useful for the project "Potential of explainable AI in enhancing trust in vessel automation" offered by the AScI program. My proficiency in SQL databases, computational coding and experience in data manipulation would be beneficial in merging different data streams into one SQL database, and understanding the typical query formats. My background in marine technology and/or ice data would be an asset in the project "Winter navigation database creation" offered by the AScI program.

I am particularly drawn to the opportunities offered by the AScI program to participate in cutting-edge research and interact with premier research groups at Aalto University. The program's focus on internationalization and its open nature to students from all countries aligns with my goal of gaining a diverse perspective in my field of study. My research interests are focused on the application of machine learning and technologies in civil, transportation, marine and traffic engineering. I am particularly interested in the potential of explainable AI in enhancing trust in vessel automation and the winter navigation database creation projects offered by the AScI program.

I am confident that my skills, experience, and interests align well with the AScI program and the projects offered, and I am eager to gain hands-on experience in my field of study. I am also looking forward to networking in an international environment and the unique summer experience in Finland. I believe that the AScI program would be an ideal platform for me to further my studies and contribute to cutting-edge research in my field. I am excited about the opportunity to participate in the Aalto Science Institute international summer research program and am confident that my expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and AI, as well as my experience in data-driven modeling, neural networks, and natural language processing, make me a strong candidate for the program. Thank you for considering my application.

In summary, I am a third-year undergraduate student at Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, majoring in Civil Engineering with auxiliary degrees in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence. My interest in AI was sparked by reading "Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies" and I have demonstrated my expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and AI through various projects and internships. I am eager to take my passion for AI to the next level by participating in the Aalto Science Institute (AScI) international summer research program at Aalto University. My background and interests align well with the program's focus on internationalization, cutting-edge research, and projects in civil, transportation, marine and traffic engineering. I am particularly interested in the potential of explainable AI in enhancing trust in vessel automation and the winter navigation database creation projects offered by the AScI program. I am confident that my skills and experience make me a strong candidate for the program and am excited about the opportunity to gain hands-on experience and network in an international environment.

this is one of my resume points-
Automatic Data Mapping using Natural Language Processing, Zopper Pvt Ltd, AI Intern.
Automated the company’s manual data mapping using customized word embeddings. Experimented with
methods for finding string similarities by converting them into vectors using word embeddings. Developed
an alternative algorithm for automatically mapping different data sets by comparing the cosine similarity
between the TF-IDF matrix of the n-grams of the columns. Achieved a mapping accuracy of 60% and a
matching accuracy of 94%

-- help me add SQL in this experience, which might help my chances in applying to one program

Automatic Data Mapping using Natural Language Processing and SQL, Zopper Pvt Ltd, AI Intern.
Automated the company’s manual data mapping using customized word embeddings and SQL. Experimented with methods for finding string similarities by converting them into vectors using word embeddings. Developed an alternative algorithm for automatically mapping different data sets by comparing the cosine similarity between the TF-IDF matrix of the n-grams of the columns. Utilized SQL queries and database management to streamline and efficiently store the mapped data. Achieved a mapping accuracy of 60% and a matching accuracy of 94%
how to answer further questions on this in interviews

During an interview, you can expand on your experience with Automatic Data Mapping using Natural Language Processing and SQL by providing more detail on the specific tasks and responsibilities you had during your internship. Some examples of things you could mention include:

* The problem or challenge the company was facing with manual data mapping and how your solution addressed it
* The specific techniques and methods you used for finding string similarities and the TF-IDF matrix of the n-grams of the columns
* Examples of SQL queries and database management tasks you performed to streamline and efficiently store the mapped data
* The results or impact of your solution, such as the mapping and matching accuracy you achieved
* Any challenges you encountered during the project and how you overcame them
* The skills and knowledge you gained from this experience that you can apply to future projects or opportunities.

in this resume point- 
Exploring Behavioral Patterns for Data-Driven Modeling of Learners’ Individual Differences, Course Project.
Conducted an extensive data analysis on the Learning Behavior and Learning Strategies data set, of 160
students. Prescribed alternate methods and enhancements to the learning environment based on the
analysis results. Predicted the students’ performance after adding the changes to the environment. Created
an interactive dashboard using Tableau to visualize and gather insights from data

-- help me add how I performed systematic literature review by reading various reasearch papers

Exploring Behavioral Patterns for Data-Driven Modeling of Learners’ Individual Differences, Course Project.
Conducted an extensive data analysis on the Learning Behavior and Learning Strategies data set, of 160 students. Performed a systematic literature review by reading various research papers and articles to gain insight into the latest trends and techniques in data-driven modeling of learners’ individual differences. Prescribed alternate methods and enhancements to the learning environment based on the analysis results and findings from the literature review. Predicted the students’ performance after adding the changes to the environment. Created an interactive dashboard using Tableau to visualize and gather insights from data.

also add how I am also interested in the project "Lockdown on the Web: The unequal impact of the COVID19 pandemic on people’s web browsing behaviour", the project's description is The COVID-19 pandemic and the challenges resulting from associated lockdowns have introduced social,
psychological, and economic hardships into people's lives and have disproportionately harmed vulnerable social
groups, exacerbating pre-existing inequalities. However, it is yet unclear how the pandemic has altered people's
information-seeking behaviour on the Web---an essential part of our lives today. We still only have a limited
understanding of how these changes might have enduring effects on people's well-being, especially for socially
disadvantaged groups.
This project will quantify and understand how the lockdowns in the physical space changed people's browsing
behaviour on the Web and investigate whether these behavioural changes persist after the lockdown(s) were
lifted.
First, we will statistically characterise individuals' web browsing traces before, during, and after lockdowns,
using individual-level data. Then, we will focus our analyses of behavioural changes of different groups of
individuals based on: (i) socio-demographic characteristics (e.g., gender, family status, economic status, size of
place of residence), and (ii) self-reported experience of the lockdown.
Required skills: good python programming skills and interest in the topic
Desired skills: familiarity with data science methods and statistical models
Too many requests in 1 hour. Try again later.
